title: Ticket #5125: Python bindings for the negotiation protocol
description:
Currently, the negotiation protocol is tied to the condor_negotiator implementation. There's no way to perform large-scale experimentation with how condor does matchmaking.

I'd like to expose the basic pieces of the negotiation protocol to the python bindings so alternate matchmaking approaches (parallel matchmaking, iterative matchmaking for new glideins) can be explored.

I think the API should look along these lines: 

claims = htcondor.Collector().getClaims() # TODO
schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
with schedd.negotiate("bbockelm@unl.edu") as session:
  for request in session:
    candidate = myGreatMatchmaker(request, claims)
    if candidate:
      session.sendClaim(claim)

The above would be a very silly negotiator indeed - but the basic building blocks would be there.

As the aim is to allow experimentation, API coverage is purposely light: no support for consumption policies, no support for p-slot claiming, etc.
remarks:
2015-Jun-30 12:05:34 by bbockelm:
First version of the API is posted. Here's the world's least-useful negotiator implementation using the API: 

import htcondor

coll = htcondor.Collector()
private_ads = coll.query(htcondor.AdTypes.StartdPrivate)
startd_ads = coll.query(htcondor.AdTypes.Startd)

claim_ads = []
for ad in startd_ads:
    if "Name" not in ad: continue
    found_private = False
    for pvt_ad in private_ads:
        if pvt_ad.get('Name') == ad['Name']:
            found_private = True
            ad['ClaimId'] = pvt_ad['Capability']
            claim_ads.append(ad)

with htcondor.Schedd().negotiate("bbockelm@unl.edu") as session:

   found_claim = False
   for resource_request in session:
       for claim_ad in claim_ads:
           if resource_request.symmetricMatch(claim_ad):
               print "Sending claim for", claim_ad["Name"]
               session.sendClaim(claim_ads[0])
               found_claim = True
               break
       if found_claim: break

Nevertheless, it's sufficient for chucking matches at a schedd.
